Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 28 Feb 2019Absolutely. When you DCA, you're taking away the guesswork of figuring out when to enter the market. The idea here is that equities over time will have a very high probability to provide you with positive return. So just remain invested. But there will be times where you should also top up your investments. After a recession, you should put down a lump sum, and increase your DCA amount until the market rebounds.0 comments0
